New Records: India scored the second-highest T20I score, three short of 300
India smashed 232 runs through boundaries, a record
Bangladesh suffered their biggest loss in terms of runs in T20Is
Key Match Events: Sanju Samson's 40-ball century, Suryakumar Yadav's improvisation and power
Riyan Parag and Hardik Pandya's 81-run partnership off 31 balls, hitting four sixes apiece
Towhid Hridoy's half-century, at a strike rate of 150 with three fours and five sixes
Post-Match Reflections: Sanju Samson's innings was a monkey off the back for him, whose talent had yet to translate into numbers in international T20s
Ravi Bishnoi showed off India's spin riches with three wickets
Miscellaneous Highlights: India handed out one final shellacking to Bangladesh on their final night of the tour
22 sixes (joint-highest for a Test-playing side) and 25 fours combined for the most runs in boundaries in a T20 innings
18 overs went for ten runs or more, one of them went for five sixes
